required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Effect of Rosuvastatin Treatment on the Prevention of Thrombosis in Patients With Previous Thrombosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Event Driven, Phase III Study of Rosuvastatin 20 mg Once Daily in the Long Term Prevention of Recurrent Venous Thromboembolism in Patients With Deep Vein Thrombosis or Pulmonary Embolism

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates whether treatment with rosuvastatin on top of standard anti-coagulant treatment will decrease the risk of recurrent venous thromboembolism and arterial thromboembolic events in patients with previous deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Due to discussion regarding the design of the study.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Any event of venous thromboembolism (i.e. Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) and/or fatal or non-fatal Pulmonary Embolism(PE))
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time to first occurrence in the overall treatment period, with a median treatment period of 9,5 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time to occurrence in the overall treatment period, with a median treatment period of 9,5 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Any event of the composite of venous thromboembolism or arterial thromboembolism/major adverse cardiovascular event (MACE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time to first occurrence in the overall treatment period and during the "on Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA)" treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first occurrence in the overall treatment period and during the "on (VKA)" treatment period, with an estimated average "on (VKA) treatment period" of 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed Consent.
- Patients with venous thromboembolism who are treated with anti-coagulant according to the current guidelines
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients in need of or already treated with lipid lowering drugs
- Active liver or kidney disease or dysfunction or muscle disorders
- Unstable medical or psychological condition that interferes with study participation
- Pregnant woman or woman with childbearing potential who are not willing to use contraception
- History of statin-related muscular pain, or hypersensitivity to statins
